description:
DNA sequence analysis has now ruled out the pupa as being either_x000d_
Liriomyza sativae Blanchard or L. trifolii (Burgess). Unfortunately, it did_x000d_
not throw up a positive match with a sequence on the on-line databases_x000d_
as an alternative.

Indeed, the results did not even conclusively confirm the pupa as an agromyzid (Diptera: Agromyzidae), although a number of Phytomyza and Liriomyza species had low level sequence homology, |  no greater or worse than similar closest matches, species in other_x000d_
dipteran families. Having exhausted all the avenues of enquiry open to me I am afraid_x000d_
that I now have to conclude that I cannot identify the pupa.
name: Agromyzidae

Fannia canicularis, the small house fly, is one of the better known species, but based on what I can see this specimen isn't F.cannicularis. | though cant be ruled out. F.cannicularis is the only reported species in the Falklands so likely human activity responsible for introducing the insect to the Falkland Ilsands.
